quotes.quote: Suburbia is where the developer bulldozes out the trees, then names the streets after them.
quotes.author: Bill Vaughan

quotes.quote: He plants trees to benefit another generation.
quotes.author: Caecilius Statius

quotes.quote: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Trees like to have kids climb on them, but trees are much bigger than we are, and much more forgiving.
quotes.author: Diane Frolov and Andrew Schneider

quotes.quote: He that plants trees loves others beside himself.
quotes.author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote:
I think that I shall never see
A poem lovely as a tree.
quotes.author: Joyce Kilmer

quotes.quote: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
quotes.author: Moliere

quotes.quote:
I think that I shall never see
a billboard lovely as a tree.
Perhaps, unless the billboards fall,
I'll never see a tree at all.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote:
There's nothing that keeps its youth,
So far as I know, but a tree and truth.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Trees, though they are cut and lopped, grow up again quickly, but if men are destroyed, it is not easy to get them again.
quotes.author: Pericles

quotes.quote: You should go to a pear tree for pears, not to an elm.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: You will find something more in woods than in books. Trees and stones will teach you that which you can never learn from masters.
quotes.author: Saint Bernard

quotes.quote: He that climbs the tall tree has won right to the fruit.
quotes.author: Sir Walter Scott

quotes.quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
quotes.author: Willa Cather

quotes.quote: As the poet said, 'Only God can make a tree' -- probably because it's so hard to figure out how to get the bark on.
quotes.author: Woody Allen
